intro: Hoorebekia acaulis, commonly known as the rock lettuce, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a rosette of broad, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, adding a delicate touch to its compact form. Hoorebekia acaulis is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
